explanation: Reasoning: The target function contains no for loop nodes itself (it uses a while loop), so to decide MISRA "for loop shall be well-formed" for this function you only need to check any called routines that could introduce side effects relevant to for-loop well-formedness when this function is used inside a for-loop body. toxdigitvalue is the only callee in the static call graph, so its declaration/definition is required to determine: (1) whether it has any persistent side effects (modifies globals or objects reachable from this function) that could interfere with a for-loop counter in a surrounding for statement, (2) whether it modifies objects passed into it (would be relevant if this function were inlined into a for-body), and (3) whether it itself contains a for loop whose behaviour could interact with loop counters. No other symbols (macros like UINT64_MAX, integer types, or standard library functions) affect the MISRA for-loop rule analysis for this target function.
